item.title: Dan Gillmor
item.description: Latest "Cornerstone of democracy..." newsletter: https://cornerstone.ghost.io/essentials-august-9-2024/I'm linking to the best journalism I can find about the 2024 elections. That does NOT include "both sides" and horse-race BS, or clickbait polling stories.Pointers today include Republican love affair with Hungary's dictatorial leader; health care; Trumpists capturing state election machinery; food and politics; and crap media.It's free, and I hope you'll pass along items you think worth other people's time.

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
dispute about data sharing for #superconductivity paper picked up by Nature
https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-024-02061-w
By refusing to share raw data authors make themselves look ridiculous at best, and suspicious at worst
#opendata

item.title: Debora Weber-Wulff
item.description: @petersuber @DailyNous @WSJ @openai If you read the text, you see that the generated text can be obfuscated by use of another system. I seriously doubt the 99.9% "accuracy", I want to see how that was determined and in particular the FN and FP rates which are so important for the use in education.A group I work with tested 14 systems last year and found them sorely lacking: https://edintegrity.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1007/s40979-023-00146-z

item.description: Listen to the Sky reporter desperately trying to stop this guy blaming Farage for inciting riots."[Farage] is a former stockbroker, a millionaire, went to one of the poshest private schools in the country and he's trying to tell working class people that migrants are their enemy. The thousands of people marching around Britain are saying actually, people like Farage are our enemy."#FuckTheFash #EatTheRich #UKPolitics #SolidarityIsBeautiful

item.title: Dan Neidle
item.description: It's unacceptable that some public companies fail to file accounts on time. Brewdog is just one of 293 - this page lists them all, and will automatically update every week.https://taxpolicy.org.uk/2024/08/10/list_of_plcs_that_have_missed_accounting_deadline/

item.title: Dan Gillmor
item.description: It's beyond comprehension that, less than two weeks after a blockbuster Washington Post report -- which strongly suggests Trump took a $10 million bribe from a foreign government during the 2016 election -- other Big Journalism organizations have made clear their indifference, by not following up.UpdateI'm asked: What should they do about it? Answer: Journalism orgs should collaborate -- investing major resources -- on investigating all of this in depth.

item.title: Thiago Carvalho
item.description:
'It's been believed for some time that being vaccinated against herpes zoster virus confers some resistance to developing dementia later in life. There are a number of lines of evidence, such as this study in Wales that uses the 1933 birth date that was a cutoff for receiving the Zostavax vaccine to show that there really does seem to be a significant effect. And just recently, the same sort of thing has been shown with the newer recombinant vaccine for shingles (Shingrix).'
#Alzheimer
https://www.science.org/content/blog-post/alzheimer-s-and-infectious-disease-story-continues

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
Stuart Buck on a very weird replication initiative at NIH.
Almost as if they don't want real replications: funding is only $50K per project; PIs volunteer their own studies for replication (by a contract organisation), and !!! PI can veto publishing the results.
WTAF.
#replication #NIH

item.title: Peter Gleick
item.description:
I've sadly come to the conclusion that the NYTimes's weak, pandering, softball, uncritical, seriously biased coverage of Trump isn't an accident but is intentional.
A zillion articles on Biden's age but not a word about Trump's slurring in their piece about his disaster on X last night

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Your brain is a computer but it's not digital. For one thing, digital computing is not energy efficient.What Is Analog Computing?
https://www.quantamagazine.org/what-is-analog-computing-20240802/

item.title: Aktionsb. neue Soziale Medien
item.description:
In den letzten Jahren haben #Mastodon-Accounts aufgesetzt:
die TU Darmstadt, die Unis in Mainz, Regensburg und Paderborn, die HTW Berlin, die PHs in Ludwigsburg und Weingarten, die HCU Hamburg, FH Margdeburg-Stendal, HfWU N√ºrtingen-Geislingen und die HfG Schw√§bisch-Gm√ºnd:
@TU, @unimainz, @uni_paderborn, @uni_regensburg, @HTW_Berlin, @phludwigsburg, @phweingarten, @HCUHamburg, @h2international, @hs_rheinmain, @HfWU, @hfg_gmuendDas ist schon ein guter Schritt in die richtige Richtung. üëå #UnisInsFediverse.
Doch viele #Fediverse-Bewohner vermissen die Posts von diesen Accounts. ü§î So geben diese #Hochschulen zwar noch Meldungen √ºber #X (ehemals #Twitter) heraus, aber kaum auf #Mastodon. Dabei warten Tausende m√∂glicher Follower im #Fediverse. Und mit guter Software ist das Bespielen beider Kan√§le so einfach, wie z.B. mit buffer.com. Wir stellen deshalb heute zur Abstimmung:

item.title: Grimm :bc:
item.description: A bunch of small-town white people who supported a coup d'etat to end American democracy in favor of being ruled with an iron first by a rapey gameshow host who can't even remotely string together a coherent sentence and wants to fuck his daughter want you to stop calling them "weird," please.
